page.title: 10CURZON COMBINED SCHOOL
page.content: This present school was built in 1961 on the site of a much older one. It was intended for 60 children maximum, but as the roll grew to 250 we had to have 4 transportable classrooms (one a double). Due to falling rolls we now have 150 children. Mr Thomas, who retired last year, was headmaster for 33 years, and Mr Birch is our new head. We have 5 teachers (3 Junior and 2 infant), and a welfare assistant. There are 35 children in our class; our teacher is Mrs Lusby. Most of us come quite a long way because our parents think it is such a good school. We have a school uniform of maroon and grey, and pink dresses for girls in the summer.We have a school badge which our deputy head, Mrs Beckett designed using the Curzon coat-of-arms.
